title: TN Assembly session from 21 June
news_body: The Tamilnadu Assembly will meet on 21 June with the customary address by Governor Banwarilal Purohit at the Kalaivanar Arangam with the Covid norms in place, Speaker of the House M Appavu said.
Speaking to reporters at the Secretariat, the Speaker said members of all parties in the Assembly would be given equal opportunity to raise issues concerning the people.

He said during the discussions on the motion of thanks to the Governor, question hour is unlikely to happen as members can raise questions after the session begins and they have to be sent to respective departments for answers.

TN Assembly session from 21 June

title: Stalin to meet Governor today
news_body: Chief Minister M K Stalin is scheduled to meet Governor Banwarilal Purohit at the Raj Bhavan later today.
Sources said that steps taken to combat the spread of coronavirus and the present situation in the State will be discussed during the meeting.
Chief Secretary V Irai Anbu and other senior officials will be present during the meeting.
It may be noted that Banwarilal Purohit handed over a cheque of Rs one crore for Covid relief works when Stalin met him last month.
Today’s meeting is taking place at a time when fresh coronavirus cases are on the decline for the past few days.

title: Key meet of AIADMK MLAs 14 June
news_body: Ahead of the budget session of Tamilnadu Assembly, the principal opposition AIADMK has called for its MLAs’ meet on 14 June.
According to sources, Deputy Leader of Opposition in the Assembly and the party’s Chief Whip will be elected during the meeting.

Former Chief Minister and AIADMK joint coordinator Edappadi K Palaniswami was recently elected as the Leader of Opposition, it may be recalled. Deputy CM O Panneerselvam, who is the party’s coordinator, is likely to be elected as the Deputy Leader of the Opposition.

title: Sputnik V reaches Tamilnadu
news_body: The first consignment of Russia’s Sputnik V Covid-19 vaccine reached Chennai by a private airline from Hyderabad on Tuesday.
The processing of the shipment at the Chennai airport was completed quickly and it was handed over to a transport agency, reports said, quoting airport sources.
Scheduled to be rolled out during the middle of June, the Sputnik V vaccine was granted emergency use authorisation by the Drugs Controller General of India.
The Russian jab will soon join Covishield and Covaxin, both made in India, in the country’s battle against Covid-19.
The post
Sputnik V reaches Tamilnadu
appeared first on

title: TN govt waives penalty for late birth, death registrations
news_body: The Tamilnadu government has announced waiver of penalty for late births and deaths registrations in the State in view of the Covid pandemic.
The waiver will be with retrospective effect from January 2020, Chief Minister M K Stalin said, according to an official release.

The government waived the penalty of Rs 100 if births and deaths are registered between 21 and 30 days late, Rs 200 if it is registered between 30 days and one year and Rs 500 beyond that as mandated in The Registration of Births and Deaths Act, 1969.

TN govt waives penalty for late birth, death registrations

title: TN govt fixes MRP for masks, sanitisers, PPE
news_body: Fifteen medical items, including face masks and hand sanitisers, have been declared as essential items by the Tamilnadu government.
It has fixed the maximum retail prices for them under the Tamilnadu Essential Articles Control and Requisitioning Act.

In a statement, the Health and Family Welfare Department said, ‘The Director of Drugs Control has informed the government that in order to ensure the availability of essential medical items during the Covid-19 pandemic at reasonable prices to common man, it is necessary to declare certain items as essential under the Tamilnadu Essential Article Control and Requisitioning Act, 1949 and to fix the maximum price of the same.’

Following this, the Governor of Tamil Nadu, Banwarilal Purohit, fixed the maximum retail price of 200 ml of hand sanitisers at Rs 110, N95 masks at Rs 22, surgical mask-2 ply at Rs 3, surgical mask-3 ply at Rs 4, surgical mask-3 ply with non-woven melt-blown fabric at Rs 4.50 per piece.
The maximum price of a set of personal protective equipment (PPE) kit is fixed at Rs 273, while the price of a disposable apron is at Rs 12.
The post
TN govt fixes MRP for masks, sanitisers, PPE

title: Assault on doctors: TN Health Minister warns action
news_body: Tamilnadu Health Minister M Subramanian today said that strict action will be taken against those who assault doctors and nurses.
He made the statement after incidents of relatives of patients attacking doctors and nurses have been reported in some places.
He further said that action will be taken against private hospitals who flout the rules and collect exorbitant fees from Covid patients. The Minister today inspected healthcare facilities in Chennai.

title: Stalin to visit Tiruvarur to review Covid-19 situation
news_body: Chief Minister M K Stalin is scheduled to visit Tiruvarur on 12 June to review the coronavirus situation in Delta districts.
This will be Stalin’s first visit to Tiruvarur, which is his home district, after becoming the Chief Minister.
Sources said that he will interact with the district Collectors above the prevention works carried out in the region.
Sources added that Stalin will visit the Mettur Dam before leaving for Tiruvarur.

title: Tamilnadu e-registration portal crashes
news_body: The Tamilnadu E-registration website https://eregister.tnega.org crashed today morning after several people tried to access the site at the same time.
The State government had announced that electricians, plumbers, carpenters and other skilled technicians will be allowed to travel from 6 am to 5 pm, provided they have availed e-registration.
Similarly government has allowed movement of private security service staff and housekeeping staff in apartment complexes after e-registration.

Tamilnadu e-registration portal crashes

title: 921 affected by black fungus in TN
news_body: As many as 921 people are affected by black fungus in the State.
Sources said that more than thousand beds have been set up for black fungus treatment all over Tamilnadu. Out of this 312 beds have been set up in government hospitals in Chennai alone.
A team of 13 medical experts has been setup to find out how black fungus infection occurs.

So far, 921 people in Tamilnadu have been diagnosed with black fungus out of which 95 per cent are getting treated in hospitals. Out of this 277 cases are from Chennai. It is said that many of them are recovering from the treatment.

921 affected by black fungus in TN

title: Covid cases declining in Tamilnadu
news_body: The number of new Coronavirus cases in Tamilnadu declined further on Sunday to 20,421 (Saturday, it was 21,410).
The toll in the state climbed to 27,005 with 434 more dying. Among the 434 deceased, 110 succumbed to the virus sans any pre-existing illness including a 21-year-old woman from Dindigul.
Three of those who tested positive today include returnees from Jharkhand, Karnataka and Kerala, the bulletin said.
Recoveries continued to outnumber new cases with 33,161 people getting discharged from hospitals totaling to 19.65 lakh till date, leaving 2,44,289 active infections.
The number of samples tested Sunday stood at 1,74,982, pushing the cumulative number of specimens examined so far to 2.87 crore.
The post
Covid cases declining in Tamilnadu

title: Lockdown with relaxations come into effect in TN
news_body: The extended lockdown with relaxations has come into effect in Tamilnadu from this morning, as the Tamilnadu government on Saturday announced extension of lockdown by one more week from 7 to 14 June, with more relaxations.

However, in 11 districts where the caseload was on the higher side, the government announced minor relaxations, while extending the lockdown. The lockdown, which was implemented on 10 May was being extended by every week to prevent the spread of the pandemic.

In a statement here, Chief Minister M K Stalin said the decision to extend the lockdown was taken based on the discussions he had with health and medical experts after reviewing the situation district-wise to prevent spread of the virus and save the precious lives of the people.

Lockdown with relaxations come into effect in TN

title: TN secures top spot in National School Index
news_body: Punjab, Tamilnadu, and Kerala topped the national school performance index with Meghalaya and Ladakh at the bottom, the Union Education Ministry said.

As many as 13 states/UTs have shown improvement by 10 per cent or more in infrastructure and facilities. Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur and Odisha have shown more than 10 per cent improvement in equity. Nineteen states and UTs have shown improvement by 10 per cent or more in governance process.

The PGI rates performance in school education based on data drawn from the Unified District Information System for Education Plus, National Achievement Survey, Mid-Day Meal, Public Financial Management System, and the Shagun portal — all maintained by the department of school education.
The post
TN secures top spot in National School Index

title: EPS, OPS hold meeting
news_body: AIADMK top leaders Edappadi K Palaniswami and O Panneerselvam today met at a star hotel in the city and discussed important issues, sources said.
Their meeting comes at a time when there were reports that there was difference of opinion between the former Chief Minister and former Deputy CM over some party affairs.

On Friday, when asked about AIADMK Coordinator Panneerselvam not present in a meeting Palaniswami had with party office-bearers, EPS denied any rift between them and said he (OPS) was busy in shifting to his new house.
“Today being an auspicious day, I came to the party office,” he said, on his first visit to the party office after becoming the Leader of the Opposition.

title: Lockdown extended in Tamil Nadu till June 14 with relaxations
news_body: State government has extended the lockdown by another week, with a few relaxations.

As the complete lockdown was scheduled to end at 6 am on June 7, Stalin held a meeting with officials yesterday, including Chief Secretary V Iraianbu, Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan, officials from Revenue and Police department and health experts.
Provision, hardware, vegetable and electrical shops can be opened between 6 am and 5 pm.
District tp district travel is barred. Only those with e-pass will be allowed. Government offices can work with 30 per cent staff. Roadside ships selling fruits and vegetables allowed.

Withh more number of cases being reported from Coimbatore, Erode, Salem, Nilgiri, Karur, Namakkal, Thanjavur, Thiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Mayiladuthurai and Tiruppur districts permission has been given for only essential services. However, more relaxations have been announced for the rest of the districts.

Lockdown extended in Tamil Nadu till June 14 with relaxations

title: No room for Sasikala in AIADMK : Palaniswami
news_body: AIADMK Joint Coordinator and Leader of the Opposition in the Tamil Nadu Assembly Edappadi Palaniswami
on Friday said there was no room for expelled leader V K Sasikala in the AIADMK.

Talking to reporters after holding a meeting with party district Secretaries here, he said Sasikala, who is the close-aide of later Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa, had already issued a statement before the Assembly polls that she was keeping away from politics.

Asked about the recent audio featuring Sasikala in which she said she would set right the AIADMK and guide it on the path shown by late leaders MGR and Jayalalithaa, he said Sasikala was not in the AIADMK.

On Sasikala hinting of her returning to active politics in the leaked audio conversations which went viral on the social media, Palaniswami said she (Sasikala) has been talking only to the AMMK, formed by her nephew TTV Dhinakaran and not with the AIADMK.
The audio has been released in an attampt to create a confusion in the AIADMK which has emerged as the strongest opposition (after the April six Assembly polls)
it will not happen
, he added.
The views of the AIADMK cadres was that Ms Sasikala should not be in the party.
Asked about AIADMK Coordinator O Panneerselvam not present in today
s meeting, Palaniswami denied any rift between them and said he (OPS) is busy in shifting to his new house.
The post
No room for Sasikala in AIADMK : Palaniswami
appeared first on

title: TN govt still to take decision on holding plus two exams
news_body: The Tamil Nadu government has said that it has not taken any decision yet on Class 12 board examinations, as some teachers and parents in the state have been pulling in different directions on the conduct of the exams.
While a majority of the teachers want the exams to be conducted, a section of parents have opposed to such school of thought.
At least 7,000 Higher Secondary schools in the state have already compiled a detailed report based on the viewpoint of parents and teachers as directed by the Education department.
The report has already been submitted to the state government on Thursday.
The post
TN govt still to take decision on holding plus two exams
appeared first on

title: CM announces granaries, drying fields in Tiruvarur for Rs 30 cr
news_body: Chief Minister MK Stalin on Thursday after launching a few schemes, including distribution of 14-item grocery assortment at fair price shops to mark former CM Karunanidhi’s birth anniversary, announced construction of granaries and grain drying fields at an estimated cost of around Rs 30 crore in Tiruvarur district.
The CM has also ordered the extension of free town bus ride to differently abled and transgender people. The order would come to force after the withdrawal of the lockdown.
